title: 108_s822
content: The "Child Care Lending Pilot Act of 2003" may be cited as the short title. It establishes the Child Care Business Loan Program. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to authorize loans with restrictions and limitations. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to authorize loans with restrictions and limitations, including the use of proceeds for small, non-profit child care businesses under certain conditions. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to allow loans for small, non-profit child care businesses, subject to specific conditions and reporting requirements by the Small Business Administration. The Small Business Administration must submit reports every 6 months on the implementation of the program to the Senate and House Committees on Small Business. The report should include the program implementation date and the issuance of rules. The report on child care small business loans must include the program implementation date, rules issuance date, and loan details for the previous 6 months. The Comptroller General of the United States must submit a report to the Committee on Small Business by March 31, 2006. The report on child care small business loans, authorized by the Small Business Investment Act of 1958, must be submitted to the Senate and House Small Business Committees. It should include information from the first 2 years of the loan program, evaluating implementation timeliness and program effectiveness. The report on child care small business loans, as required by the Small Business Investment Act of 1958, should evaluate the timeliness of loan program implementation, effectiveness of participation by Certified Development Companies, lenders, and small businesses, marketing strategies, and the number of businesses applying for and approved for loans. The report should evaluate businesses that applied for, were approved for, and received loans under the program. It should also include details on the number of businesses in each State, total amount loaned, and average loan amount and term. The Small Business Administration will issue final rules for the loan program within 120 days of the Act's enactment. The amendments will be in effect until September 30, 2006, applying to all loans made during the specified period.
